overview:
Brandon is a start-up executive with a proven track record of building value with technology ventures. In the past fourteen years, he has founded or cofounded numerous new ventures including online retail, Internet services, eLearning, wireless software, and search.

Brandon achieved early success with CreateTech (which was acquired by Broadcast.com in 1997) where he served as VP Interactive through its historic IPO and subsequent acquisition by Yahoo! Then, on the heels of the Yahoo acquisition, Brandon left and helped raise $3MM to co-found a Christian music site called Musicforce.com. The company quickly gained market traction and was acquired during its first year of operation by Gaylord Entertainment.

Brandon went on to found numerous other ventures in the subsequent years, both successful and not, gaining valuable experience from each. In April 2009, Brandon founded Doublewide Partners and acquired industry veteran invoicing site Blinksale.com and begin to re-shape and grow that business.

Most recently, Brandon founded and serves as CEO of ZenCash, a web-based service for following up with customers who don’t pay on time.
